chargeHist.descr: Use or Possess w/ Intent to Use Masking Agent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to probation today.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes: Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations or follow thru with current AODA if completed within the last 6 months.
Follow thru with Programs for Change.

No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. 
Not to have contact with known users/dealers except as necessary for treatment or in a confinement setting. 
Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow rules of supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$300.05 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

timeConds.notes: Subject to work release, no good time. Stayed.

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM Defendant Jacob R Lewis in court.  Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Jacob R Lewis.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk. 
Count 1-poss meth w/ repeater-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 2-poss narcotics w/ repeater-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
DRI-3-7
CT finds def waiving PSI.

SENTENCE:  

Count 1-poss meth-w/h, probation 3 yrs, concurrent with ea. AODA or follow thru w/ current within last 6 mo. Follow thru w/ programs for change. No illegal substances. NO contact w/ users/dealers. Follow rules of supervision. Must report to probation today. 12 mo CT, subj to WR, no GT-stayed. 2 days credit. DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $300.05 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 

Count 2-poss narcotics-w/h, probation 3 yrs, concurrent with ea. AODA or follow thru w/ current within last 6 mo. Follow thru w/ programs for change. No illegal substances. NO contact w/ users/dealers. Follow rules of supervision. Must report to probation today. DNA sample, $250 surcharge, $300.05 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 

PCR. 11:42 am adj.

10:18 AM Defendant Jacob R Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Jacob R Lewis. CW-clerk. Sanders-ask to set for plea hearing. Bond cont. 10:
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

8:51 AM Defendant Jacob R Lewis in court, in custody of PCJ.    Attorney Derek W Sanders in court for Jacob R Lewis. Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  AW-clerk.    Waiver of PH.  CT-address DE regarding Waiver finds DE FVIK  and CT accepts waiver.  CT finds Identification is made and venue established.  CT-finds PC and DE is bound over.  CT Preserved for 15 on pre argn rights. 
State filing information.  Waive reading, NG Plea entered  CT accepts Plea.   Bont cont.  8:56  am adj
Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.addlTxt: No controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion. Not to use or possess identifying documents of others without their permission. No possession of masking agents including fake urine.

1:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob R Lewis appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Derek W Sanders appeared by video for Jacob R Lewis. CW-clerk. Qualifies, reading waived. CT sets bond. 1:08 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 08:45 am.
